pull.title: Cleanups to port mapping module post UPnP drop
pull.body: Based on #31130, this does a couple cleanups to `src/mapport.*` to clarify the logic now that there is a single protocol option for port mapping.

events.body:

rename.from: Cleanups to port mapping module post UPnP dropt
rename.to: Cleanups to port mapping module post UPnP drop

events.body: i'll review this when #31130 is merged, i have some of my own ideas about portmap.cpp as well that i haven't fully worked out yet.

verification.payload:
tree 56083d535ccb91ad34fc899b2070e0bc651ac062
parent da10e0bab4a3e98868dd663af02c43b1dc8b7f4a
author Antoine Poinsot <darosior@protonmail.com> 1729883244 -0400
committer Antoine Poinsot <darosior@protonmail.com> 1730153297 -0400

mapport: make 'enabled' and 'current' bool

Since there is only a single protocol now, clarify the code by changing
the protocol enum for a bool for both variables.

events.message:
mapport: make 'enabled' and 'current' bool

Since there is only a single protocol now, clarify the code by changing
the protocol enum for a bool for both variables.

verification.payload:
tree f59a94ff048f53d57aeee12488d7bccd214cf9c5
parent c4e82b854cdd3702d20a6afc49ef26bda9d2ba24
author Antoine Poinsot <darosior@protonmail.com> 1729883612 -0400
committer Antoine Poinsot <darosior@protonmail.com> 1730153307 -0400

mapport: remove 'use_pcp' argument

No need to specify it, that's the only one available now.

events.message:
mapport: remove 'use_pcp' argument

No need to specify it, that's the only one available now.

comments.body: By adding this if here, this no longer accounts for the situation where port mapping is turned from on to off. i think i slightly prefer the old API for `mapPort`.
Ah, yeah, right, that was stupid. I'll stick to just renaming `use_pcp` to `enabled`.
